info.description: This is Swagger UI environment generated for the TMF Enhancement to Privacy Management API specification
info.title: TMF644 Privacy Management

scopes.TMF_PRIVACY_MANAGEMENT_ALL: API Consumer is allowed to consume all the operations.
scopes.TMF644_PRIVACY_MANAGEMENT_ALL: API Consumer is allowed to consume all the operations.

post.description: This operation is used to create a privacy profile type.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
* Contains the APIX OAuth token as Bearer token.
* Enables the developer application access to the request resource.
* E.g. Authorization:Bearer FhNX09SlBO4G0XRzTPAGustXtsWi

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of data sent in the request.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request HTTP header advertises which content types, expressed as MIME types, the client is able to understand.

parameters.name: vf-trace-transaction-id
parameters.description:
* Consumer specified unique transaction identifier.
 * Enables requests from consumers to be captured end to end.
* If not provided in the request, one is generated by the backend.
 * Format: Case insensitive, RFC 2616.

parameters.name: vf_ext_bp_id
parameters.description: A unique use case ID used for logging and end-to-end tracing.

parameters.name: partyPrivacyProfileType
parameters.description: Object representation of the party privacy profile type to be created

x-example.name: Customer Mass Market Privacy
x-example.description: This is customer Mass Market Privacy

partyPrivacyProfileTypeCharacteristic.name: eMailAddress
partyPrivacyProfileTypeCharacteristic.description: Email address privacy for internal ADMIN purpose

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
* Contains the APIX OAuth token as Bearer token.
* Enables the developer application access to the request resource.
* E.g. Authorization:Bearer FhNX09SlBO4G0XRzTPAGustXtsWi

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of data sent in the request.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request HTTP header advertises which content types, expressed as MIME types, the client is able to understand.

parameters.name: vf-trace-transaction-id
parameters.description:
* Consumer specified unique transaction identifier.
 * Enables requests from consumers to be captured end to end.
* If not provided in the request, one is generated by the backend.
 * Format: Case insensitive, RFC 2616.

agreementPeriod.description: The time period during which the agreement is in effect

completionDate.description: Date at which the agreement is completed

description.description: Narrative that explains the agreement and details about the it , such as why the agreement is taking place

href.description: Unique URL identifying the agreement as a resource

initialDate.description: Date at which the agreement was initialized

name.description: A human-readable name for the agreement

statementOfIntent.description: An overview and goals of the agreement

status.description: The current status of the agreement. Typical values are: in process, approved and rejected

type.description: The type of the agreement. For example 'commercial'

version.description: A string identifying the version of the agreement

engagedPartyRole.description: Reference to the Party or Party Role involved in the Agreement

reason.description: Text that explains the reason for error. This can be shown to a client user.

message.description: Text that provides more details and corrective actions related to the error. This can be shown to a client user.
